thread.title: A blogfather’s lament for the Web
thread.title_full: A blogfather’s lament for the Web

author: Hossein Derakhshan
title: A blogfather’s lament for the Web
text:
Don’t stop here. Go unlimited. 
We hope you’ve enjoyed your 10 free articles this month. 
We know that is not enough and can seem a bit, well, limited, so why not try a digital subscription to Globe Unlimited and get: Unlimited Access Award-winning Globe and Mail articles, photo galleries and exclusive videos Subscriber-only Content Insight and analysis on the business, financial and political breaking news stories of the day Globe Recognition Membership Access exclusive events, shows, concerts and pre-sale tickets Immerse yourself in globeandmail.com today for a special introductory trial rate of 99¢ for the first month. 
Already a print newspaper subscriber? Click here to get full access to Globe Unlimited. 
Already a Globe Unlimited subscriber? Log in to keep reading. Keep me logged in Women in a Tehran coffee shop access a Facebook page to check out new fashions. For millions of users around the world, Facebook is the Web. (Kaveh Kazemi/Getty Images) A blogfather’s lament for the Web Hossein Derakhshan Tehran — The Globe and Mail 
Published Monday, Oct. 19, 2015 6:00AM EDT 
Last updated Saturday, Oct. 17, 2015 2:38PM EDT 
Hossein Derakhshan writes about new media and Iran at hoder.com and is working on an art project titled ‘Link-age’ at the New Media Society in Tehran.
